alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 7:23AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...A TSUNAMI ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR ENTIRE CALIFORNIA COAST, AS WELL AS OREGON AND WASHINGTON COASTS... ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTHWEST CALIFORNIA COAST... * LOCAL IMPACTS... A TSUNAMI CAPABLE OF PRODUCING STRONG CURRENTS THAT MAY BE HAZARDOUS TO SWIMMERS...BOATS...AND COASTAL STRUCTURES IS EXPECTED. WIDESPREAD INUNDATION IS NOT EXPECTED. * RECOMMENDED ACTIONS... IF YOU ARE LOCATED IN THIS COASTAL AREA...MOVE OFF THE BEACH AND OUT OF HARBORS AND MARINAS. DO NOT GO TO THE COAST TO WATCH THE TSUNAMI. BE ALERT TO INSTRUCTIONS FROM YOUR LOCAL EMERGENCY OFFICIALS * FORECAST TSUNAMI START TIMES... FORT BRAGG CALIFORNIA 0735 AM PST ON JAN 15 CRESCENT CITY CALIFORNIA 800 AM PST ON JAN 15 TSUNAMIS OFTEN ARRIVE AS A SERIES OF WAVES OR SURGES WHICH COULD BE DANGEROUS FOR MANY HOURS AFTER THE FIRST WAVE ARRIVAL. THE FIRST TSUNAMI WAVE OR SURGE MAY NOT BE THE HIGHEST IN THE SERIES. * FORECAST TSUNAMI DURATION... EXPECT STRONG CURRENTS AND WITH ADDITIONAL WAVES POSSIBLE FOR AT LEAST A FEW HOURS AFTER THE INITIAL ARRIVAL TIME. * FORECAST PEAK TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS... 1 TO 3 FEET. * OBSERVED TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS FROM EARLIER... NONE OBSERVED YET. * PRELIMINARY EARTHQUAKE INFORMATION... A STRONG VOLCANIC ERUPTION OCURRED AT 827 PM PST ON JAN 14 2022, NEAR THE ISLAND OF TONGA IN THE SOUTH PACIFIC OCEAN, TRIGGERING A TSUNAMI. * TIDE INFORMATION... HUMBOLDT BAY NORTH SPIT...LOW TIDES OF -0.2 FT AT 444 PM PST ON JAN 15...AND 3.8 FT AT 409 AM PST ON JAN 16. HIGH TIDES OF 7.4 FT AT 927 AM PST ON JAN 15...AND 5.4 FT AT 1147 PM PST ON JAN 15. CRESCENT CITY HARBOR...LOW TIDES OF -0.1 FT AT 440 PM PST ON JAN 15...AND 3.9 FT AT 407 AM PST ON JAN 16. HIGH TIDES OF 7.3 FT AT 917 AM PST ON JAN 15...AND 5.6 FT AT 1134 PM PST ON JAN 15. THIS PRODUCT WILL BE UPDATED AS NEW INFORMATION BECOMES AVAILABLE. STAY TUNED TO YOUR LOCAL NEWS SOURCE AND NOAA WEATHER RADIO FOR FURTHER INFORMATION AND UPDATES.
